text: hello this is Bill Cunningham and you
know every season in Paris the long trip
the fighting to get into the shows and
then you get there and you see the most
marvelous beautiful collections and you
realize it's worth all the trouble to
get in and one of the outstanding ones I
thought was the Valentino I mean
absolute sheer beauty from beginning to
end and the evening dresses which I know
few people wear except over there there
were about a dozen women wearing their
evening dresses to the afternoon show a
2:30 show I think that's great but the
collections shown and the women
attending in wearing the clothes from
the previous collection and it was just
a remarkable sight outside and inside
the show we were absolutely drenched
with pure beauty I could only think of
Botticelli's Birth of spring that famous
painting in the diaphanous dresses well
the Valentino ones reflected that same
quality of permissible transparency it
was absolutely beautiful I know in
fashion today there's a big anti Beauty
movement tough and aggressive but
there's another gentler side of fashion
and this was it without a doubt
